node.title: Why New Zealanders are eating less kale
node.description: Kale has fallen out of favour with New Zealand consumers, with the country's largest grower of salad crops reporting a significant decline in sales.

node.title: Tornadoes Tear Through South and Midwest, With at Least 70 Dead in Kentucky
node.description: Power was out across the region on Saturday, and severe storms were expected to continue.

node.title: California official says she was stalked by members of an anti-vaccine group.
node.description: By Vimal Patel

node.title: Thousands again march in Australian cities against vaccine mandates, pandemic restrictions
node.description: Thousands-strong crowds gather in Melbourne and other cities to protest, many holding signs and chanting slogans against vaccine rules.

node.title: Border loosening should be postponed amid rise of Omicron - Baker
node.description: Epidemiologist Michael Baker says current border restrictions need to stay longer to keep Omicron out of the country. Audio

node.title: Bryce Young wins Heisman Trophy
node.description: Young became the first Crimson Tide quarterback to win college football's top honor on Saturday night.

node.title: Bryce Young Wins 2021 Heisman Trophy
node.description: This gives Alabama football yet another first-time accomplishment in its storied history.

node.title: Businesses call for rethink of COVID-19 cluster naming as connection affects sales
node.description: Parafield, Modbury, Thebarton and Norwood are no longer just Adelaide suburbs but the names of COVID-19 clusters, which local business owners say has a major impact on their foot traffic.

node.title: Nine kea and a dog killed after 1080 drops last year
node.description: Nine kea and a dog were killed as the result of three different 1080 aerial drop operations last year.

node.title: Colds and flus may re-emerge as lockdowns ease
node.description: Christmas could bring the sniffles for those who have been in lockdown for months.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation," December 12, 2021
node.description: Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear, Arkansas Governor Asa Hutchinson, and more appear on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" Sunday.

node.title: How to help victims of Friday's deadly storms
node.description: At least 70 people were killed in Kentucky, which was among the hardest hit areas.

node.title: Scenes From the Aftermath of the Deadly Tornadoes
node.description: Residents across six states in the South and Midwest awoke Saturday to unimaginable damage from a series of storms.

node.title: Teen Shoots Man Strangling Mom in Pizza Shop Robbery, Blood Trail Leads to Suspect: Police
node.description: The boy's mother, an employee, was reportedly being choked by one of the suspects after she was unable to open the pizzeria's cash register.

node.title: School District Ordered to Preserve Electronic Evidence Amid Oxford High Shooting Lawsuits
node.description: The order comes as lawyers contend the school district has destroyed evidence related to the mass shooting.

node.title: Rand Paul Opposition to Previous Disaster Relief Resurfaces as He Seeks Aid for Kentucky
node.description: The GOP Senator previously voted against disaster relief for Hurricanes Harvey, Maria and Sandy.

node.title: Deadly tornado tracks for more than 320km across US Midwest
node.description: A monstrous tornado, carving a track that could rival the longest on record, rips through the middle of the US in a storm front killing dozens as it tears apart homes and buildings.

node.title: How this property owner hopes to trade beachfront views for bitcoin
node.description: A large slice of tropical paradise bordering the Coral Sea has become one of the first properties in regional Queensland to be put up for sale for cryptocurrency.

node.title: Up to 50,000 cars could enter Queensland tomorrow as state prepares for border reopening
node.description: Queensland has recorded just one case of COVID-19, as the countdown begins for the much-anticipated border reopening.

node.title: First NSW Omicron case in hospital among 10 new infections of the variant
node.description: NSW Health reports a person is hospitalised after contracting the Omicron variant — the first since the new strain landed in Australia.

node.title: What I really want for Christmas: Ricky Houghton
node.description: Ricky Houghton works with some of the Far North's poorest, finding them homes, reuniting families and giving them hope. Here, he shares his Christmas wish list for his community.

node.title: Police believe Margaret River fire was 'deliberately lit' as threat level downgraded
node.description: Police are appealing for information after confirming a fire that ripped through Western Australia's world-famous wine and surfing region was deliberately lit.

node.title: Health authorities confirm Omicron COVID variant is in SA
node.description: Test results confirm two cases of COVID-19 recorded in South Australia are the Omicron variant.

node.title: The Monkees star Michael Nesmith dies at 78
node.description: The singer, guitarist and songwriter's death comes just weeks after the 1960s pop group responsible for hits like Daydream Believer completed a farewell tour. Audio

node.title: 11-year-old driver with four passengers under 10 referred to youth aid
node.description: An 11-year-old child has been referred to Youth Aid Services, after a fleeing driver incident in Rotorua on Friday night.

node.title: Missing her home in Afghanistan, Rabiha found a new one at a local library
node.description: Rabiha felt lonely in her new home on the other side of the world, until she discovered the magic of stories and learned how to create a community.

node.title: Queensland throws open its borders tomorrow — so what exactly does that mean?
node.description: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says Queensland is reopening "on our terms". When that finally happens in less than 24 hours, here are the roadmap details you'll need to bear in mind.

node.title: The Big Question: Could Peloton Sue Over Its ‘And Just Like That’ Appearance?
node.description: A Peloton stationary bike played a pivotal role on the new HBO Max “Sex and the City” revival, whose premiere preceded a drop in the company’s stock price on Friday.

node.title: In a Kentucky Town Hit by a Tornado, Anguish, Worry — and Feeling Grateful to Be Alive
node.description: A tornado devastated much of Mayfield, Ky., leaving a close-knit community to grapple with what it has lost and what it will take to recover.

node.title: Banksy sells limited edition T-shirt for statue-toppling defendants
node.description: The grey shirt features the word Bristol above the empty plinth on which the statue of 17th century slave merchant Edward Colston long stood, with a rope hanging from it and debris scattered around.
